policies.involuntary_refund:
✅ A full refund is allowed if:
• The flight is canceled
• The schedule is changed by 3 or more hours.
policies.involuntary_reissue:
’ involuntary reissue policy if:
• Same route, same RBD, same carrier, and within ±3 days.
policies.voluntary_refund:
• Fare rules of the operating carrier apply
• Penalties collected via CP tax code
• If multiple carriers involved on 275 ticket, apply the most restrictive rule
policies.medical_refund:
All waiver requests must include full PNR history, as GP does not have direct access to bookings.
• Submit via BSPLink, ARC, or APG Connect Helpdesk.
• Waiver required when:
  → Rebooking involves different RBD
  → No alternates available
  → Flight operated by another carrier
• Use ENDO BOX indicators:
  → SKCHG (for involuntary reissues)
  → ONEFREECHANGE (for voluntary 1-time penalty waiver)
policies.name_change:
Name corrections are permitted for the same passenger only (not transferable).

Steps:
1. Create a new booking with correct name (same RBD or higher)
2. Issue a new ticket on GP-275
3. Notify APG with the new ticket number
4. APG will provide a waiver for refund of the original ticket

• A $25 penalty applies to all name corrections.
policies.group_booking:
A group is defined as 10 or more passengers traveling together.
• Group quote requests are processed within 48 hours.
• APG provides group quotes only for airlines it has a direct partnership with.
• Quotes and ticketing are subject to availability and the policies of the operating carrier.
• For all group requests, submit through official APG Connect channels or contact the Helpdesk
policies.infant_policy:
All infant and child travel rules follow the operating carrier’s policy.
• Ensure the proper SSR codes are included in the booking
• If baggage allowance for infants is required, confirm directly with the operating carrier prior to departure
policies.baggage_policy:
Baggage policies, including weight limits, delayed baggage, or compensation, are dictated by the operating carrier.
• APG does not handle baggage claims directly
• Denied boarding and baggage delay insurance available via Blue Ribbon Bags:
  → €125 (ticket difference)
  → €75 (hotel)
  → €50 (transfers)
  → $1,000/bag after 96h delay (up to 2 bags)
policies.seat_request_policy:
Seat assignments, mobility assistance, and special meal requests are handled directly by the **operating carrier**.
• APG does not process special service requests for interline segments.
• All ancillary service inquiries must be directed to the airline operating the segment in question.
policies.short_term_cancellation_policy: Voiding is allowed on the day of issuance only. After that, standard refund or reissue policies apply according to fare rules and waiver eligibility.
